pageContext.claim:
“'Nancy Pelosi and the Democrats haven't met the standards of impeachment. They have to be very careful here.' Jeanne Zaino.
@FoxNews”
pageContext.analysis: The constitution does not outline "standards" for impeachment but left the requirement for "high crimes and misdemeanors" relatively vague, so the House could impeach not even on a violation of criminal law. (High refers to the office, not the type of crime.)
